content.query:
CREATE PROCEDURE dbo.nyc_taxi_procedure
AS
BEGIN

SELECT
    CAST([paymentType] AS [bigint]) AS [paymentType],
    CAST([passengerCount] AS [bigint]) AS [passengerCount],
    [tripTimeSecs],
    CAST([pickupTimeBin] AS [varchar]) AS [pickupTimeBin]
INTO [dbo].[#nyc_taxi]
FROM [dbo].[nyc_taxi];

SELECT *
FROM PREDICT (MODEL = (SELECT [model] FROM dbo.nyc_taxi_tip_aml_model WHERE [ID] = 'nyc_taxi_tip_predict:3'),
              DATA = [dbo].[#nyc_taxi],
              RUNTIME = ONNX) WITH ([output_label] [bigint])

END
GO

EXEC dbo.nyc_taxi_procedure

properties.description: SQL Script to query JSON files in datalake

content.query:
-- Create a db master key if one does not already exist, using your own password.
-- CREATE MASTER KEY ENCRYPTION BY PASSWORD='<EnterStrongPasswordHere>';

-- Create a database scoped credential with the workspace managed IDENTITY
IF NOT EXISTS (select 1 from sys.database_scoped_credentials where name = 'ba-synapse01-kn3acb6lw3vr4')
    CREATE DATABASE SCOPED CREDENTIAL [ba-synapse01-kn3acb6lw3vr4]
    WITH IDENTITY = 'MANAGED IDENTITY'

-- Create EXTERNAL FILE Format as JSON not explicitly required for SQL Serverless. The format used by OPENROWSET is CSV

--Create External Data Source
IF NOT EXISTS (select 1 from sys.external_data_sources where name ='sec-form10q')
    CREATE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE [sec-form10q]
    WITH (    LOCATION   = 'https://badatalake01kn3acb6lw3vr.dfs.core.windows.net/curated-silver/sec-form10q' --'https://<storage_account>.dfs.core.windows.net/<container>/<path>'
            ,CREDENTIAL = [ba-synapse01-kn3acb6lw3vr4]
    )


--Query Single file
select top 10 *
from openrowset(
        bulk '2023/04/standardized_2023-04-16_141247_sec-form10q.json/part-00000-f814e8bd-a2fe-4bbd-82d7-acef0a1625af-c000.json',
        data_source = 'sec-form10q',
        format = 'csv',
        fieldterminator ='0x0b',
        fieldquote = '0x0b',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '0x0b'
    ) with (doc nvarchar(max)) as rows


--Query multiple files using wildcards
select top 10 *
from openrowset(
        bulk '*/*/*/part*.json',
        data_source = 'sec-form10q',
        format = 'csv',
        fieldterminator ='0x0b',
        fieldquote = '0x0b',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '0x0b'
    ) with (doc nvarchar(max)) as rows


--Flatten with OPENJSON
select top 10 *
from openrowset(
        bulk '*/*/*/part*.json',
        data_source = 'sec-form10q',
        format = 'csv',
        fieldterminator ='0x0b',
        fieldquote = '0x0b',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '0x0b'
    ) with (doc nvarchar(max)) as rows
cross apply openjson(doc)
with (org_name varchar(50) '$.org_name'
    ,org_address varchar(400) '$.org_address'
    ,org_jurisdiction varchar(100) '$.org_jurisdiction'
    ,org_stock_ticker varchar(5) '$.org_stock_ticker'
    ,reporting_quarter varchar(20) '$.reporting_quarter'
    ,stock_exchange varchar(10) '$.stock_exchange'
    ,total_assets int '$.total_assets'
    ,total_comprehensive_income int '$.total_comprehensive_income'
    ,total_equity int '$.total_equity'
    ,total_liabilities int '$.total_liabilities'
    ,mgmt_analysis varchar(MAX) '$.mgmt_analysis'
    ,risk_disclosure varchar(MAX) '$.risk_disclosure'
    ,controls_procedures varchar(MAX) '$.controls_procedures'
    ,mgmt_analysis_summary varchar(100) '$.mgmt_analysis_summary'
    ,risk_disclosure_summary varchar(100) '$.risk_disclosure_summary'
    ,controls_procedures_summary varchar(100) '$.controls_procedures_summary'
    ) 

    DROP VIEW vwSecForm10Q
    GO
    --Create View
    CREATE VIEW vwSecForm10Q AS
        select * 
        from openrowset(
                bulk '*/*/*/part*.json',
                data_source = 'sec-form10q',
                format = 'csv',
                fieldterminator ='0x0b',
                fieldquote = '0x0b',
                ROWTERMINATOR = '0x0b'
            ) with (doc nvarchar(max)) as rows
        cross apply openjson(doc)
        with (org_name varchar(50) '$.org_name'
            ,org_address varchar(400) '$.org_address'
            ,org_jurisdiction varchar(100) '$.org_jurisdiction'
            ,org_stock_ticker varchar(5) '$.org_stock_ticker'
            ,reporting_quarter varchar(20) '$.reporting_quarter'
            ,stock_exchange varchar(10) '$.stock_exchange'
            ,total_assets int '$.total_assets'
            ,total_comprehensive_income int '$.total_comprehensive_income'
            ,total_equity int '$.total_equity'
            ,total_liabilities int '$.total_liabilities'
            ,mgmt_analysis varchar(MAX) '$.mgmt_analysis'
            ,risk_disclosure varchar(MAX) '$.risk_disclosure'
            ,controls_procedures varchar(MAX) '$.controls_procedures'
            ,mgmt_analysis_summary varchar(MAX) '$.mgmt_analysis_summary'
            ,risk_disclosure_summary varchar(MAX) '$.risk_disclosure_summary'
            ,controls_procedures_summary varchar(MAX) '$.controls_procedures_summary'
            ) 
--Query View
select * from vwSecForm10Q

properties.description: Script to create a view from HTAP CosmosDB

content.query:
IF (NOT EXISTS(SELECT * FROM sys.credentials WHERE name = 'ba-cosmosdb1'))
    CREATE CREDENTIAL [ba-cosmosdb1] WITH IDENTITY = 'SHARED ACCESS SIGNATURE', SECRET = '<CosmodDBKey>'

IF (NOT EXISTS(SELECT * FROM sys.schemas WHERE name = 'htap_cosmosdb'))
   EXEC ('CREATE SCHEMA [htap_cosmosdb]')

CREATE OR ALTER VIEW [htap_cosmosdb].[volcano_htap]
AS SELECT id, Country, [Status], Elevation, [Type],Region, [Location]
from OPENROWSET(​PROVIDER = 'CosmosDB',
                CONNECTION = 'Account=ba-cosmosdb1;Database=SampleDB',
                OBJECT = 'Volcano_HTAP',
                SERVER_CREDENTIAL = 'ba-cosmosdb1'
) WITH
    (id varchar(50),
    Country varchar(50),
    Status varchar(20),
    Elevation int,
    Type varchar(20),
    Region varchar(100),
    Location varchar(1000)) as rows


-- SELECT top 10 * from [htap_cosmosdb].[volcano_htap]

properties.description: Reusable functions for Azure Active Directory

source: # Re-usable functions for Azure Active Directory

tenandIdSecret = "<Azure Key Vault Secret for TenantID>"
servicePrincipalIdSecret = "<Azure Key Vault Secret for Service Principal ID>"
servicePrincipalSecret = "<Azure Key Vault Secret for Service Principal secret>"
authUrl = "https://login.windows.net"
resourceUrl = "https://database.windows.net/"

def getBearerToken():
    ############################################################################
    # getBearerToken
    # Returns a bearer token for a service principal AAD authentication
    #
    # Parameters:
    #       None
    #
    # Returns:
    #     Bearer Token  
    ############################################################################

    tenantId = getSecret(tenandIdSecret)
    servicePrincipalId = getSecret(servicePrincipalIdSecret)
    secret = getSecret(servicePrincipalSecret)

    assert tenantId is not None, "tenantId not specified"
    assert servicePrincipalId is not None, "servicePrincipalId not specified"
    assert secret is not None, "secret not specified"
    assert authUrl is not None, "authUrl not specified"
    assert resourceUrl is not None, "resourceUrl not specified"

    authority = authUrl + "/" + tenantId
    try:
        context = adal.AuthenticationContext(authority)
        token = context.acquire_token_with_client_credentials(resourceUrl, servicePrincipalId, secret)
        accessToken = token["accessToken"]
    except Exception as e:
        print("getBearerToken failed with exception:")
        raise e
    return accessToken

properties.description: Generic Level 1 Transform Notebook for Synapse Dedicated SQL Pool Target

source:
L1TransformInstanceID = None
L1TransformID = None
IngestID = None
CustomParameters = None
InputRawFileSystem = None
InputRawFileFolder = None
InputRawFile = None
InputRawFileDelimiter = None
InputFileHeaderFlag = None
OutputL1CurateFileSystem = None
OutputL1CuratedFolder = None
OutputL1CuratedFile = None
OutputL1CuratedFileDelimiter = None
OutputL1CuratedFileFormat = None
OutputL1CuratedFileWriteMode = None
OutputDWStagingTable = None
LookupColumns = None
OutputDWTable = None
OutputDWTableWriteMode = None
ReRunL1TransformFlag = None
DeltaName = None

# # Parameters for Testing only, should be commented off
# L1TransformInstanceID = 1
# L1TransformID = 3
# IngestID = 3
# CustomParameters = None
# InputRawFileSystem = 'raw-bronze'
# InputRawFileFolder = 'purview/operations/2022-07'
# InputRawFile = 'operations_20220720.parquet'
# InputRawFileDelimiter = None
# InputFileHeaderFlag = 1
# OutputL1CurateFileSystem = 'curated-silver'
# OutputL1CuratedFolder = 'purview/operations/1900-01'
# OutputL1CuratedFile = 'standardized_operations_19000101.parquet'
# OutputL1CuratedFileDelimiter = None
# OutputL1CuratedFileFormat = 'parquet'
# OutputL1CuratedFileWriteMode = 'overwrite'
# OutputDWStagingTable = 'stg.merge_Azure_operations'
# LookupColumns = ['name']
# OutputDWTable = 'Azure.operations'
# OutputDWTableWriteMode = 'append'
# ReRunL1TransformFlag = None
# DeltaName = None
# Read Raw file and apply basic data cleansing and data enrichments

df = readFile(container=InputRawFileSystem, path= InputRawFileFolder + '/' + InputRawFile, colSeparator=InputRawFileDelimiter, headerFlag=InputFileHeaderFlag)
ingestCount = df.count()

ct=CommonTransforms(df)

# Remove duplicates
df=ct.deDuplicate()

# Remove leading and trailing spaces from all string columns
df=ct.trim()

# Replace Null Value with generic values
df = ct.replaceNull(0)
df = ct.replaceNull("NA")
df = ct.replaceNull("2020-01-01")

# Add literal value columns for e.g SparkJobId
audit={"WorkspaceName": mssparkutils.env.getWorkspaceName(), "SparkJobId":mssparkutils.env.getJobId(), "SparkPool" : mssparkutils.env.getPoolName(), "SparkClusterId" :mssparkutils.env.getClusterId()}
df = ct.addLitCols(audit)

pos = OutputDWTable.find(".")
schemaName = OutputDWTable[0:pos]
tableName = OutputDWTable[pos+1:]

posStg = OutputDWStagingTable.find(".")
stgSchemaName = OutputDWStagingTable[0:posStg]
stgTableName = OutputDWStagingTable[posStg+1:]

l1TransformCount = df.count()

if OutputDWTableWriteMode == 'append' and OutputDWStagingTable is not None and LookupColumns is not None:
    upsertSdp(df,SchemaStagingTable=stgSchemaName,StagingTable=stgTableName, SchemaTargetTable=schemaName, TargetTable=tableName, KeyColumns=LookupColumns, DeltaColumn=DeltaName) 
else:
    insertSdpTable(df, schema=schemaName,table=tableName, mode=OutputDWTableWriteMode)

properties.description: Notebook to simplify the json generated by form recognizer

source:
L1TransformInstanceID = None
L1TransformID = None
IngestID = None
CustomParameters = None
InputRawFileSystem = None
InputRawFileFolder = None
InputRawFile = None
InputRawFileDelimiter = None
InputFileHeaderFlag = None
OutputL1CurateFileSystem = None
OutputL1CuratedFolder = None
OutputL1CuratedFile = None
OutputL1CuratedFileDelimiter = None
OutputL1CuratedFileFormat = None
OutputL1CuratedFileWriteMode = None
OutputDWStagingTable = None
LookupColumns = None
OutputDWTable = None
OutputDWTableWriteMode = None
ReRunL1TransformFlag = None
DeltaName = None

# # Parameters for Testing only, should be commented off
# L1TransformInstanceID = 1
# L1TransformID = 4
# IngestID = 4
# CustomParameters = None
# InputRawFileSystem = 'raw-bronze'
# InputRawFileFolder = 're-statements/2023/04'
# InputRawFile = '2023-04-05_194935_re-statement.json'
# InputRawFileDelimiter = None
# InputFileHeaderFlag = None
# OutputL1CurateFileSystem = 'curated-silver'
# OutputL1CuratedFolder = 're-statements/2023/04'
# OutputL1CuratedFile = 'standardized_2023-04-05_194935_re-statement.json'
# OutputL1CuratedFileDelimiter = None
# OutputL1CuratedFileFormat = 'json'
# OutputL1CuratedFileWriteMode = 'overwrite'
# OutputDWStagingTable = None
# LookupColumns = None
# OutputDWTable = None
# OutputDWTableWriteMode = None
# ReRunL1TransformFlag = None
# DeltaName = None

import pyspark.sql.functions 
df = readFile(InputRawFileSystem, InputRawFileFolder +"/" + InputRawFile, None, None)
ingestCount = df.count()

# extract datapoints of interest and explode array

# df.printSchema()
df = df.select(col("fields.RE agency.valueString").alias("re_agency")
            ,col("fields.owner.valueString").alias("owner")
            ,col("fields.owner address.valueString").alias("re_agency_address")
            ,col("fields.rental address.valueString").alias("rental_address")
            ,col("fields.statement date.valueString").alias("statement_date")
            ,col("fields.tenant.valueString").alias("tenant")
            ,col("fields.total payment.valueString").alias("total_payment")
            ,explode(col("fields.statement details.valueArray")).alias("statement details")
            )

df = df.select("re_agency","owner","re_agency_address","rental_address","statement_date","tenant","total_payment"
                ,col("statement details.valueObject.amount.valueString").alias("item_amount")
                ,col("statement details.valueObject.item description.valueString").alias("item_description"))
df.printSchema()

#write flattened json to curated zone of data lake
l1TransformCount = df.count()
writeFile(df,OutputL1CurateFileSystem, OutputL1CuratedFolder + "/" + OutputL1CuratedFile)

properties.description: Notebook to summarize SEC Form 10Q statement using AOAI

source: # Install SynapseML for this spark session

L1TransformInstanceID = None
L1TransformID = None
IngestID = None
CustomParameters = None
InputRawFileSystem = None
InputRawFileFolder = None
InputRawFile = None
InputRawFileDelimiter = None
InputFileHeaderFlag = None
OutputL1CurateFileSystem = None
OutputL1CuratedFolder = None
OutputL1CuratedFile = None
OutputL1CuratedFileDelimiter = None
OutputL1CuratedFileFormat = None
OutputL1CuratedFileWriteMode = None
OutputDWStagingTable = None
LookupColumns = None
OutputDWTable = None
OutputDWTableWriteMode = None
ReRunL1TransformFlag = None
DeltaName = None

# # Parameters for Testing only, should be commented off
# L1TransformInstanceID = 6
# L1TransformID = 8
# IngestID = 5
# CustomParameters = None
# InputRawFileSystem = 'raw-bronze'
# InputRawFileFolder = 'sec-form10q/2023/04'
# InputRawFile = '2023-04-16_141247_sec-form10q.json'
# InputRawFileDelimiter = None
# InputFileHeaderFlag = None
# OutputL1CurateFileSystem = 'curated-silver'
# OutputL1CuratedFolder = 'sec-form10q/2023/04'
# OutputL1CuratedFile = 'standardized_2023-04-16_141247_sec-form10q.json'
# OutputL1CuratedFileDelimiter = None
# OutputL1CuratedFileFormat = 'json'
# OutputL1CuratedFileWriteMode = 'overwrite'
# OutputDWStagingTable = '[stg].[merge_sec_form10q]'
# LookupColumns = ['org_name','reporting_quarter']
# OutputDWTable = '[sec].[form10q]'
# OutputDWTableWriteMode = 'append'
# ReRunL1TransformFlag = None
# DeltaName = None

from pyspark.sql.functions import *
from pyspark.sql.types import *
df = readFile(InputRawFileSystem, InputRawFileFolder +"/" + InputRawFile, None, None)
ingestCount = df.count()

# df.printSchema()

df = df.select( col("org_name.content").alias("org_name")
                ,col("org_address.content").alias("org_address")
                ,col("org_jurisdiction.content").alias("org_jurisdiction")
                ,col("org_stock_ticker.content").alias("org_stock_ticker")
                ,col("reporting_quarter.content").alias("reporting_quarter")
                ,col("stock_exchange.content").alias("stock_exchange")
                ,regexp_replace(col("total_assets.content"),",","").cast(IntegerType()).alias("total_assets")
                ,regexp_replace(col("total_comprehensive_income.content"),",","").cast(IntegerType()).alias("total_comprehensive_income")
                ,regexp_replace(col("total_equity.content"),",","").cast(IntegerType()).alias("total_equity")
                ,regexp_replace(col("total_liabilities.content"),",","").cast(IntegerType()).alias("total_liabilities")                
                ,col("mgmt_analysis.content").alias("mgmt_analysis")
                ,col("risk_disclosure.content").alias("risk_disclosure")
                ,col("controls_procedures.content").alias("controls_procedures")

import os
from synapse.ml.core.platform import running_on_synapse, find_secret
from synapse.ml.cognitive import OpenAICompletion

aoaiEndpoint = getSecret("aoai-endpoint")
aoaiDeploymentName = "gpt35"
aoaiApiKey = getSecret("aoai-api-key")

#Summary1
dfPrompt_mgmt_analysis = df.select( col("mgmt_analysis")
                                    , concat(lit("summarize the text below.\n"),lit("text:"),col("mgmt_analysis"),lit("\n summary:")).alias("mgmt_analysis_prompt"))
completion = (
    OpenAICompletion()
    .setSubscriptionKey(aoaiApiKey)
    .setDeploymentName(aoaiDeploymentName)
    .setUrl(aoaiEndpoint)
    .setMaxTokens(100)
    .setPromptCol("mgmt_analysis_prompt")
    .setErrorCol("error")
    .setOutputCol("mgmt_analysis_summary")
)

dfSummaryMgmtAnalysis = completion.transform(dfPrompt_mgmt_analysis).cache()
# display(dfSummaryMgmtAnalysis.select(
#   col("mgmt_analysis_prompt"), col("error"), col("mgmt_analysis_summary.choices.text").getItem(0).alias("text")))
# dfSummaryMgmtAnalysis.printSchema()

dfSummaryMgmtAnalysis = dfSummaryMgmtAnalysis.select(col("mgmt_analysis_summary.choices.text").getItem(0).alias("mgmt_analysis_summary"))

#Summary2
dfPrompt_risk_disclosure = df.select( col("risk_disclosure")
                                    , concat(lit("summarize the text below.\n"),lit("text:"),col("risk_disclosure"),lit("\n summary:")).alias("risk_disclosure_prompt"))
completion = (
    OpenAICompletion()
    .setSubscriptionKey(aoaiApiKey)
    .setDeploymentName(aoaiDeploymentName)
    .setUrl(aoaiEndpoint)
    .setMaxTokens(100)
    .setPromptCol("risk_disclosure_prompt")
    .setErrorCol("error")
    .setOutputCol("risk_disclosure_summary")
)

dfSummaryRisk = completion.transform(dfPrompt_risk_disclosure).cache()
# display(dfSummaryRisk.select(
#   col("risk_disclosure_prompt"), col("error"), col("risk_disclosure_summary.choices.text").getItem(0).alias("text")))
# dfSummaryRisk.printSchema()

dfSummaryRisk = dfSummaryRisk.select(col("risk_disclosure_summary.choices.text").getItem(0).alias("risk_disclosure_summary"))

#Summary3
dfPrompt_controls_procedures = df.select( col("controls_procedures")
                                    , concat(lit("summarize the text below.\n"),lit("text:"),col("controls_procedures"),lit("\n summary:")).alias("controls_procedures_prompt"))
completion = (
    OpenAICompletion()
    .setSubscriptionKey(aoaiApiKey)
    .setDeploymentName(aoaiDeploymentName)
    .setUrl(aoaiEndpoint)
    .setMaxTokens(100)
    .setPromptCol("controls_procedures_prompt")
    .setErrorCol("error")
    .setOutputCol("controls_procedures_summary")
)

dfSummaryCP = completion.transform(dfPrompt_controls_procedures).cache()
# display(dfSummaryCP.select(
#   col("controls_procedures_prompt"), col("error"), col("controls_procedures_summary.choices.text").getItem(0).alias("text")))
# dfSummaryCP.printSchema()

dfSummaryCP = dfSummaryCP.select(col("controls_procedures_summary.choices.text").getItem(0).alias("controls_procedures_summary"))

from functools import reduce
from pyspark.sql import DataFrame

#Merge all the dataframes
dfs = [df,dfSummaryMgmtAnalysis,dfSummaryRisk,dfSummaryCP]
dfFinal = reduce(DataFrame.crossJoin, dfs)
display(dfFinal)
# Write summarized json to curated zone of data lake

properties.description: Reusable functions for Azure SQL and SQL Server

source: # Re-usable functions for Azure SQL and SQL Server

server="<Azure SQL Server/ SQL Server>"
database = "<Database Name>"
usernameSecret = "<Azure Key Vault Secret for SQL User>"
passwordSecret = "<Azure Key Vault Secret for SQL User Password>"

def getJdbcUrl():
  # ##########################################################################################################################  
  # Function: getJdbcUrl
  # Creates the JDBC Connection String from the input parameters to this notebook
  # 
  # Parameters:
  # None
  #
  # Returns:
  # JDBC Connection String
  # ##########################################################################################################################  
    assert server is not None, "server not specified"
    assert database is not None, "database not specified"
    assert usernameSecret is not None, "usernameSecret not specified"
    assert passwordSecret is not None, "passwordSecret not specified"

    user =  getSecret(usernameSecret)
    password = getSecret(passwordSecret)
    jdbcUrl = "jdbc:sqlserver://" + server + ".database.windows.net:1433;database=" + database + ";user=" + user + "@" + server + ";password=" + password + ";encrypt=true;trustServerCertificate=false;hostNameInCertificate=*.database.windows.net;loginTimeout=30;"
    return jdbcUrl

def readTable(table):
  # ##########################################################################################################################  
  # Function: readTable
  # Reads all the rows and columns of an Azure SQL table/view and returns the records as dataframe
  # 
  # Parameters:
  # table = Input Table/View including the schema name. E.g soccer.goalpost, afl.goalpost
  #
  # Returns:
  # Dataframe containing all rows and columns of a table/view in Azure SQL
  # ##########################################################################################################################  
    assert table is not None, "table not specified"

    jdbcUrl = getJdbcUrl()

    try:
      df = (spark.read
              .format("jdbc")
              .option("driver","com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver")
              .option("url",jdbcUrl)
              .option("dbtable",table)
              .load()
          )
    except Exception as e:
        print("readTable({}) failed with exception:".format(table))
        raise e


    ## Use Apache Spark Connector in Future instead of JDBC connector for faster execution. At the moment Apache Spark Connector is not available on newer Spark Runtime
    ## Have to install a library from maven coordinates:com.microsoft.azure:spark-mssql-connector_2.12:1.2.0
    ## https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/connect/spark/connector?view=sql-server-ver16
    #   df = (spark.read
    #           .format("com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.spark")
    #           .option("url",jdbcUrl)
    #           .option("dbtable",table)
    #           .load()
    #       )
    return df

def readQuery(query):
  # ##########################################################################################################################  
  # Function: readQuery
  # Executes the input query at Azure SQL and returns the records as dataframe
  # 
  # Parameters:
  # query = A valid input query
  #
  # Returns:
  # Dataframe containing all rows and columns returned by query from Azure SQL
  # ##########################################################################################################################  
  assert query is not None, "query not specified"

  jdbcUrl = getJdbcUrl()
  try:
    df = (spark.read
            .format("jdbc")
            .option("driver","com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver")
            .option("url",jdbcUrl)
            .option("query",query)
            .load()
        )
  except Exception as e:
        print("readQuery({}) failed with exception:".format(query))
        raise e
    ## Use Apache Spark Connector in Future instead of JDBC connector for faster execution. At the moment Apache Spark Connector is not available on newer Spark Runtime
    ## Have to install a library from maven coordinates:com.microsoft.azure:spark-mssql-connector_2.12:1.2.0
    ## https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/connect/spark/connector?view=sql-server-ver16
    #   df = (spark.read
    #           .format("com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.spark")
    #           .option("url",jdbcUrl)
    #           .option("dbtable",table)
    #           .load()
    #       )
  return df

def insertTable(df,table,writeMode,preserveSchema = None):
  # ##########################################################################################################################  
  # Function: insertTable
  # Inserts a dataframe to a Azure SQL
  # 
  # Parameters:
  # df = Input dataframe
  # table = Target table where the datafframe is loaded
  # writeMode = Describes how data from dataframe is inserted to datawarehouse table. Allowed values are - append/overwrite/ignore/error/errorifexists
  # preserveSchema = True/False. Applicable only in overwrite mode when schema needs to be preserved
  # Returns:
  # None
  # ########################################################################################################################## 
  assert table is not None, "query not specified"
  assert writeMode is not None, "writeMode not specified"
  assert writeMode in ["append","overwrite","ignore","error","errorifexists"] , "writeMode is invalid. Allowed values are append,overwrite,ignore,error,errorifexists"

  jdbcUrl = getJdbcUrl()
  
  try:
    if writeMode == "overwrite" and preserveSchema == True :
      #Truncate and Append instead of overwrite to preserve table schema
      (df.write
      .format("jdbc")
      .option("driver","com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver")
      .option("url",jdbcUrl)
      .mode("append")
      .option("truncate", "true") # Must be string "true" and not boolean True
      .option("dbtable",table)
      .save()
      )
    else:
      (df.write
      .format("jdbc")
      .option("driver","com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver")
      .option("url",jdbcUrl)
      .mode(writeMode)
      .option("dbtable",table)
      .save()
      ) 
  except Exception as e:
        print("insertTable({}) failed with exception:".format(query))
        raise e 
    ## Use Apache Spark Connector in Future instead of JDBC connector for faster execution. At the moment Apache Spark Connector is not available on newer Spark Runtime
    ## Have to install a library from maven coordinates:com.microsoft.azure:spark-mssql-connector_2.12:1.2.0
    ## https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/connect/spark/connector?view=sql-server-ver16
    #   df = (spark.read
    #           .format("com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.spark")
    #           .option("url",jdbcUrl)
    #           .option("dbtable",table)
    #           .load()

def upsert(df,SchemaStagingTable,StagingTable, SchemaTargetTable, TargetTable, KeyColumns,IdentityColumns=None, DeltaColumn=None) :
# ##########################################################################################################################  
# Function: upsert
# Performs a Merge/Upsert action on a Azure SQL table
# 
# Parameters:
# df = Input dataframe
# StagingTable = Name of Table used to temporarily stage the input data frame
# SchemaStagingTable = Database schema of staging table
# SchemaTargetTable = Database schema of target table
# TargetTable  = Name of Target Table
# KeyColumns = List of columns that uniquely defines a record in input dataframe
# IdentityColumns = List of Identity Columns that needs to be excluded from Inserts and Updates
# DeltaColumn = Name of watermark column in input dataframe
#
# Returns:
# None
# ##########################################################################################################################  

    insertTable(df,SchemaStagingTable + "." + StagingTable,"overwrite")
    

    insertCols=""
    updateCols=""
    whereCols =""
    keyCols = ""

    # MATCHED Clause of MERGE
    for keyCol in KeyColumns:
        keyCols = keyCols + "source." + keyCol + " = " + "target." + keyCol + " and "

    whereClause = keyCols
    #Tidy up where clause and remove last "and"
    remove="and"
    reverse_remove=remove[::-1]
    whereClause = whereClause[::-1].replace(reverse_remove,"",1)[::-1]

    # INSERT and UPDATE part of MERGE
    for col in df.schema.fieldNames():
        if col not in IdentityColumns: # Exclude Identity columns in Insert statement
            insertCols = insertCols + col + ","
        if col not in KeyColumns and col not in IdentityColumns: # Exclude key and Identity columns in update statement
            updateCols =  updateCols + "target." + col + " = " + "source." + col + ","

    #Tidy up insertCols and remove last ","
    remove=","
    reverse_remove=remove[::-1]
    insertCols = insertCols[::-1].replace(reverse_remove,"",1)[::-1]  

    #Tidy up insertCols and remove last ","
    remove=","
    reverse_remove=remove[::-1]
    updateCols = updateCols[::-1].replace(reverse_remove,"",1)[::-1]   

    # MERGE Statement in full
    mergeSQL= "MERGE INTO " + SchemaTargetTable +"." + TargetTable + " AS target" +  " USING " + SchemaStagingTable + "." + StagingTable + " AS source" + " ON "
    mergeSQL = mergeSQL + whereClause

    # WHEN MATCHED
    if DeltaColumn != None:
        mergeSQL =  mergeSQL + " WHEN MATCHED AND " + "source." + DeltaColumn + " > " + "target." + DeltaColumn 
    else:
        mergeSQL =  mergeSQL + " WHEN MATCHED"

    mergeSQL = mergeSQL + " THEN UPDATE SET " + updateCols

    # WHEN NOT MATCHED BY TARGET
    mergeSQL = mergeSQL + " WHEN NOT MATCHED BY TARGET " # including BY TARGET clause for Synapse requires the table to be Hash Distributed
    mergeSQL = mergeSQL + " THEN INSERT " +  "("+ insertCols +")" + " VALUES " + " ( "+ insertCols +" ) "

    mergeSQL = mergeSQL +";"
    
    #Execute Merge Statement using Pyodbc
    uid = getSecret(usernameSecret)
    pwd = getSecret(passwordSecret)
 
    try:
        cnxn = pyodbc.connect("DRIVER={ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server};SERVER=" + server + ".database.windows.net" + ";DATABASE=" + database + ";UID=" + uid + ";PWD=" + pwd )
        cursor = cnxn.cursor()
        cnxn.autocommit = True

        cursor.execute(mergeSQL)
    except Exception as e:
        print("Upsert to {}.{} failed with exception:".format(SchemaTargetTable,TargetTable))
        raise e

    print("Upsert statement executed successfully : {} ".format(mergeSQL))
    return

properties.description: A collection of reusable Python classes that extends out of box PySpark capabilities

source: # What is CommonTransforms and how to use them in your notebooks ?
CommonTransforms is a Python class that uses PySpark libraries to apply common transformations to a Spark dataframe. https://github.com/bennyaustin/pyspark-utils/blob/main/CommonTransforms/README.md

from pyspark.sql.functions import trim,when,isnull,lit,col,from_utc_timestamp,to_utc_timestamp,concat_ws,sha1,length,substring,lit,concat,date_add,expr,year,datediff
from pyspark.sql import functions as F 
import datetime

def readFile(container, path, colSeparator=None, headerFlag=None):
  # ##########################################################################################################################  
  # Function: readFile
  # Reads a file from Azure Gen2 Storage and returns as dataframe
  # 
  # Parameters:
  # storageAccount = Name of Storage Account  
  # container = File System/Container of Azure Data Lake Storage
  # path = realtive path of file including folder name, file name and file extension. For e.g /folder/file.extension
  # colSeparator = Column separator for text files
  # headerFlag = boolean flag to indicate whether the text file has a header or not  
  # 
  # Returns:
  # A dataframe of the raw file
  # ##########################################################################################################################    

    assert storageAccount is not None, "Storage Account not specified"   

    filePath = "abfss://" + container + "@"+ storageAccount + ".dfs.core.windows.net/" + path
    if ".csv" in path or ".txt" in path:
        df = spark.read.csv(path=filePath, sep=colSeparator, header=headerFlag, inferSchema="true")
    elif ".parquet" in path:
        df = spark.read.parquet(filePath)
    elif ".json" in path:
        df = spark.read.json(filePath, multiLine= True)
    elif ".orc" in path:
        df = spark.read.orc(filePath)
    else:
        df = spark.read.format("csv").load(filePath)
  
    df =df.dropDuplicates()
    return df

def writeFile(df,container, path, writeMode="overwrite", colSeparator=","):
  # ##########################################################################################################################  
  # Function: writeFile
  # Writes the input dataframe to a file in Azure Gen2 Storage
  # 
  # Parameters:
  # df= input dataframe
  # storageAccount = Name of Storage Account
  # container = File System/Container of Azure Data Lake Storage
  # path = realtive path of file including folder name, file name and file extension. For e.g /folder/file.extension
  # writeMode= mode of writing the curated file. Allowed values - append/overwrite/ignore/error/errorifexists
  # colSeparator = Column separator for text files
  # 
  # Returns:
  # A dataframe of the raw file
  # ##########################################################################################################################     
    assert storageAccount is not None, "Storage Account not specified"   
    filePath = "abfss://" + container + "@"+ storageAccount + ".dfs.core.windows.net/" + path
    if "csv" in path or 'txt' in path:
        df.write.csv(filePath,mode=writeMode,sep=colSeparator,header="true")
    elif "parquet" in path:
        df.write.parquet(filePath,mode=writeMode)
    elif "orc" in path:
        df.write.orc(filePath,mode=writeMode)
    elif "json" in path:
        df.write.json(filePath, mode=writeMode)
    else:
        df.write.save(path=filePath,format="csv",mode=writeMode)
    return
# Re-usable functions for Azure Synapse SQL Dedicated Pool

import com.microsoft.spark.sqlanalytics
from com.microsoft.spark.sqlanalytics.Constants import Constants
import sys

def readSdpTable(schema,table,colList=None,filterCondition=None,limitRows=None):
  # ##########################################################################################################################  
  # Function: readSdpTable
  # Reads records from the Azure Synapse Dedicated Pool table/view and returns as dataframe
  # 
  # Parameters:
  #     schema          = Schema name of the Azure Synapse Dedicated Pool table.
  #     table           = Table Name.
  #     colList         = (Optional) List of columns to be returned in the dataframe. 
  #                       E.g ["col1","col2","col3"].
  #                       Returns all columns if none provided.
  #     filterCondition = (Optional) Expression to filter the dataframe as push-down filter to database. 
  #                       E.g col("Title").contains("E").
  #                       Returns all rows when not provided.
  #     limitRows       = (Optional) Integer to fetch N records from the table.
  #                       Returns all rows when none provided.
  #
  # Returns:
  #     Dataframe containing the relevant rows and columns of an Azure Synapse Dedicated Pool table/view
  # ##########################################################################################################################  
    assert server is not None, "Server not specified"
    assert database is not None, "Database not specified"
    assert schema is not None, "Schema not specified"
    assert table is not None, "Table not specified"

    tableName = database + "." + schema+ "." + table
   
    try:
        if server is not None and database is not None and schema is not None and table is not None:
            df = (spark.read
                        .option(Constants.SERVER,server)
                        .synapsesql(tableName)
                )

        if colList is not None:
            df = df.select(colList)
        
        if filterCondition is not None:
            df = df.filter(filterCondition)

        if limitRows is not None:
            df = df.limit(limitRows)
    except Exception as e:
        print("Read from {}.{} failed with exception:".format(schema,table))   
        raise e
    return df

def insertSdpTable(df, schema,table, mode):
  # ##########################################################################################################################  
  # Function: insertSdpTable
  # Writes a dataframe to an Azure Synapse Dedicated Pool table
  # 
  # Parameters:
  #     df              = Dataframe to be written to Azure Synapse Dedicated Pool table.
  #     schema          = Schema name of the Azure Synapse Dedicated Pool table.
  #     table           = Table Name.
  #     mode            = Write mode to table. 
  #                       Options for write modes are "error" or "errorifexists" (default), "overwrite", "append", "ignore".
  #
  # Returns:
  #     None
  # ##########################################################################################################################  
    assert server is not None, "Server not specified"
    assert database is not None, "Database not specified"
    assert schema is not None, "Schema not specified"
    assert table is not None, "Table not specified"
    assert mode in ["append","overwrite","error","errorifexists","ignore"], "Invalid mode specified. Mode should be either append,overwrite,error,errorifexists or ignore"

    tableName = database + "." + schema+ "." + table
    try:
      (df.write
          .option(Constants.SERVER, server)
          .mode(mode)
          .synapsesql(tableName))
    except Exception as e:
      print("Insert to {}.{} failed with exception:".format(schema,table))
      raise e
    return

from pyspark.sql.functions import *
import datetime
from pyspark.sql.window import *
from delta.Tables import *

def deleteReRunDeltaLake(Table, ColumnName, TransformInstanceID):
    # ##########################################################################################################################  
    # Function: deleteReRunDeltaLake
    # Deletes records on Delta Table for a ReRun
    #
    # Parameters:
    # Table = Name of Target Table
    # ColumnName = ColumnName of TransformInstanceID
    # TransformInstanceID = TransformInstanceID passed from Framework
    # 
    # Returns:
    TableExist = False
    try:
        deltaZone = mssparkutils.credentials.getSecretWithLS("Key Vault","DeltaLake-StorageAccount")
        deltaZoneKey = mssparkutils.credentials.getSecretWithLS("Key Vault","DeltaLake-StorageAccessKey")
        spark.conf.set("fs.azure.account.key." + deltaZone + ".dfs.core.windows.net",  deltaZoneKey)
        spark.read.table(Table)
        TableExist = True
        deltaTable = DeltaTable.forName(spark, Table)
        deltaStatement = (ColumnName + ' = ' + str(TransformInstanceID))
        deltaTable.delete(deltaStatement)
        print("Records deleted: " + Table)
    except:
        print("Table does not exist: " + Table)

from pyspark.sql.functions import *
import datetime
from pyspark.sql.window import *

def insertDeltaLake(df, TargetTable, Container, Folder, WriteMode):
    # ##########################################################################################################################  
    # Function: insertDeltaLake
    # Performs a Insert/Overwrite action on Delta Table
    #
    # Parameters:
    # df = input dataframe
    # TargetTable = Name of Target Table
    # Container = Container used for creating Delta table schema and merging new data
    # Folder = Folder used for creating Delta table schema and merging new data
    # WriteMode = Wether the write option is Overwrite/Append
    # Need to Enable Schema Evolution
    # spark.sql("SET spark.databricks.delta.schema.autoMerge.enabled = true") 
    # 
    # Returns:
    deltaZone = mssparkutils.credentials.getSecretWithLS("Key Vault","DeltaLake-StorageAccount")
    deltaZoneKey = mssparkutils.credentials.getSecretWithLS("Key Vault","DeltaLake-StorageAccessKey")
    spark.conf.set("fs.azure.account.key." + deltaZone + ".dfs.core.windows.net",  deltaZoneKey)
    deltaPath = "abfss://" + Container + "@"+ deltaZone + ".dfs.core.windows.net/" + Folder

    if WriteMode == "append" :
        try:
            df.write.option("mergeSchema", "true").format("delta").mode("append").insertInto(TargetTable)
        except:
            df.write.format("delta").save(deltaPath)

    if WriteMode == "overwrite" :
        df.write.option("mergeSchema", "true").format("delta").mode("overwrite").save(deltaPath)

    spark.sql("CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS " + TargetTable +" USING DELTA LOCATION '" + deltaPath + "'")
kvLinkedService ='your Azure Key Vault Linked Service referenced by this Synapse Workspace'

def getSecret (secretName):
# ##########################################################################################################################  
# Function: getSecret
# Returns the value of a secret stored in Azure Key Vault that is referenced as link service
# 
# Parameters:
# secretName = Name of secret in Azure Key Vault
# 
# Returns:
# The value of secret stored in Azure Key Vault
# ##########################################################################################################################
    assert secretName is not None, "secretName not specified"
    try:
        return mssparkutils.credentials.getSecretWithLS(kvLinkedService,secretName) #kvLinkedService is a notebook parameter set by the calling notebook
    except Exception as e:
        print("Either Linked Service: " + kvLinkedService + " does not exist or Secret: " + secretName + " does not exist")
        raise e

properties.description: Notebook to unit test commonTransforms class

source:
# Test File
file = "abfss://raw-bronze@bastoragedatalake01.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-yellowtaxi-trip/yellow_tripdata_2020-01.csv"
# Config schema explicitly for testing purposes
dataSchema="VendorID STRING,tpep_pickup_datetime TIMESTAMP,tpep_dropoff_datetime TIMESTAMP,passenger_count INT,trip_distance DOUBLE,RatecodeID STRING,store_and_fwd_flag STRING,PULocationID INT,DOLocationID INT,payment_type INT,fare_amount DOUBLE,extra DOUBLE,mta_tax DOUBLE,tip_amount DOUBLE,tolls_amount DOUBLE,improvement_surcharge DOUBLE,total_amount DOUBLE,congestion_surcharge DOUBLE"
input=spark.read.csv(path=file,schema=dataSchema,header=True)
display(input)

ct=CommonTransforms(input)

# Remove duplicates
output=ct.deDuplicate()

# Remove duplicates based on key columns
output=ct.deDuplicate(["VendorID","tpep_pickup_datetime","tpep_dropoff_datetime"])

# Remove leading and trailing spaces from all string columns
output=ct.trim()

# Replace Null Value with generic values
output = ct.replaceNull(0)
output = ct.replaceNull("NA")
output = ct.replaceNull("2020-01-01")

# Replace Null value in Timestamp columns
output = ct.replaceNull("1900-01-01T00:00:00","tpep_pickup_datetime")
output = ct.replaceNull("9999-12-31T23:59:59","tpep_dropoff_datetime")

# Replace Null Values with custom defaults
output = ct.replaceNull({"passenger_count":1,"store_and_fwd_flag":"N","tip_amount":0,"tolls_amount":0, "improvement_surcharge":0,"congestion_surcharge":0})

# Convert UTC timestamps to local
output = ct.utc_to_local("Australia/Sydney")
output = ct.utc_to_local("Australia/Sydney",["tpep_pickup_datetime","tpep_dropoff_datetime"])


# Convert local timestamps to UTC
output = ct.local_to_utc("Australia/Sydney")
output = ct.local_to_utc("Australia/Sydney",["tpep_pickup_datetime","tpep_dropoff_datetime"])

# Convert time from one Timezone to another
output = ct.changeTimezone("Australia/Sydney","America/New_York")

# Drop system/non-business columns
output = ct.dropSysColumns("store_and_fwd_flag")

# Add Checksum
output = ct.addChecksumCol("checksum")

# Convert Julian date to Calendar date
output = ct.julian_to_calendar("sys_date1")

# Convert Calendar date to Julian
output =ct.calendar_to_julian("sys_date2")

# Add literal value columns for e.g audit columns
audit={"audit_key":66363,"pipeline_id":"56f63394bb06dd7f6945f636f1d4018bd50f1850", "start_datetime": "2020-10-01 10:00:00", "end_datetime": "2020-10-01 10:02:05"}
output = ct.addLitCols(audit)

sql = """INSERT INTO stg.nyc_tlc_yellow_trip (vendorID,tpepPickupDateTime,tpepDropoffDateTime,passengerCount,tripDistance,puLocationId,doLocationId,startLon,startLat,endLon,endLat,rateCodeId,storeAndFwdFlag
      ,paymentType
      ,fareAmount
      ,extra
      ,mtaTax
      ,improvementSurcharge
      ,tipAmount
      ,tollsAmount
      ,totalAmount)
SELECT top 100 vendorID
      ,tpepPickupDateTime
      ,tpepDropoffDateTime
      ,passengerCount
      ,tripDistance
      ,puLocationId
      ,doLocationId
      ,startLon
      ,startLat
      ,endLon
      ,endLat
      ,rateCodeId
      ,storeAndFwdFlag
      ,paymentType
      ,fareAmount
      ,extra
      ,mtaTax
      ,improvementSurcharge
      ,tipAmount
      ,tollsAmount
      ,totalAmount
  FROM nyct.nyc_tlc_yellow_trip
  WHERE NOT EXISTS
  (SELECT 1 FROM stg.nyc_tlc_yellow_trip
  where stg.nyc_tlc_yellow_trip.vendorID= nyct.nyc_tlc_yellow_trip.vendorID
  and stg.nyc_tlc_yellow_trip.tpepPickupDateTime = nyct.nyc_tlc_yellow_trip.tpepPickupDateTime
  and stg.nyc_tlc_yellow_trip.tpepDropoffDateTime = nyct.nyc_tlc_yellow_trip.tpepDropoffDateTime)"""

cursor.execute(sql)

properties.description: Notebook for unit testing upsertSdp-function

source: # upsert Synapse Dedicated SQL Pool Table

from pyspark.sql.functions import *
import datetime
from pyspark.sql.window import *

def upsertDeltaLake(df, TargetTable, Container, Folder, KeyColumns=None, DeltaColumn=None):
    # ##########################################################################################################################  
    # Function: upsertDeltaLake
    # Performs a Merge/Upsert action on Delta Table
    #
    # Parameters:
    # df = input dataframe
    # TargetTable = Name of Target Table
    # Container = Container used for creating Delta table schema and merging new data
    # Folder = Folder used for creating Delta table schema and merging new data
    # KeyColumns = List of columns that uniquely defines a record in input dataframe
    # DeltaColumn = Name of watermark column in input dataframe
    # 
    # Returns:
    # Print - Lookup Statement
      
    deltaZone = mssparkutils.credentials.getSecretWithLS("Key Vault","DeltaLake-StorageAccount")
    deltaZoneKey = mssparkutils.credentials.getSecretWithLS("Key Vault","DeltaLake-StorageAccessKey")
    spark.conf.set("fs.azure.account.key." + deltaZone + ".dfs.core.windows.net",   deltaZoneKey)

    #Read Columns Names from Dataframe
    deltaPath = "abfss://" + Container + "@"+ deltaZone + ".dfs.core.windows.net/" + Folder
    columns = (((str(df.columns).replace("'", "")).replace("[","")).replace("]","")).replace(" ","")

    uniqueCols = KeyColumns.split("|")

    #Create Schema
    DeltaTable.createIfNotExists(spark) \
    .location(deltaPath) \
    .addColumns(df.schema) \
    .execute()

    lookupStatement = ""  
    for lookupCol in uniqueCols:
        lookupStatement = lookupStatement + TargetTableAlias + "." + lookupCol  + " = " + stagingTableAlias + "." + lookupCol + " and " 

    watermarkLookup = ""
    if DeltaColumn is not None and  len(DeltaColumn) >0:
        lookupUpdateStatement = lookupStatement + stagingTableAlias  +"."+ DeltaColumn  + " >= "+ TargetTableAlias + "." + DeltaColumn + " and " + TargetTableAlias  +"."+ DeltaColumn  + " < "+ stagingTableAlias + "." + DeltaColumn
        remove="and"
        reverse_remove=remove[::-1]
        lookupStatement = lookupStatement[::-1].replace(reverse_remove,"",1)[::-1]

    if DeltaColumn is None or len(DeltaColumn)==0:
        remove="and"
        reverse_remove=remove[::-1]
        lookupStatement = lookupStatement[::-1].replace(reverse_remove,"",1)[::-1]
        lookupUpdateStatement = lookupStatement

    #Update Expression
    updateStatement = ""
    updateColumns = columns.split(",")
    for updateCols in updateColumns:
        updateStatement = updateStatement + '"' +updateCols  + '": "' +  stagingTableAlias + "." + updateCols + '", ' 

    #Convert Insert and Update Expression in to Dict
    updateStatement = json.loads("{"+updateStatement.rstrip(', ')+"}")
    
    # Write to DeltaPath
    deltaTable = DeltaTable.forPath(spark, deltaPath)
    deltaTable.alias(TargetTableAlias).merge(df.alias(stagingTableAlias), lookupUpdateStatement).whenMatchedUpdate(set = updateStatement).execute()
    deltaTable.alias(TargetTableAlias).merge(df.alias(stagingTableAlias), lookupStatement).whenNotMatchedInsert(values = updateStatement).execute()
    
    #Create Table
    spark.sql("CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS " + TargetTable +" USING DELTA LOCATION '" + deltaPath + "'")
    print(lookupUpdateStatement +"; " + lookupStatement)

properties.description: Notebook that implements upsert function using PyOdbc

source: # Re-usable Upsert function for Azure Synapse Analytics SQL Dedicated Pool

server="<Azure Synapse DedicatedSQLPool>"
database = "<Azure Synapse DedicatedSQLPool/Azure SQL>"
sqlUidSecret = "Azure Key Vault Secret for DedicatedSQLPool user name"
sqlPwdSecret = "Azure Key Vault Secret for DedicatedSQLPool password"

def upsertSdp(df,SchemaStagingTable,StagingTable, SchemaTargetTable, TargetTable, KeyColumns, DeltaColumn=None) :
# ##########################################################################################################################  
# Function: upsertSdp
# Performs a Merge/Upsert action on a Azure SQL table
# 
# Parameters:
# df = Input dataframe
# StagingTable = Name of Table used to temporarily stage the input data frame
# SchemaStagingTable = Database schema of staging table
# SchemaTargetTable = Database schema of target table
# TargetTable  = Name of Target Table
# KeyColumns = List of columns that uniquely defines a record in input dataframe
# DeltaColumn = Name of watermark column in input dataframe
#
# Returns:
# None
# ##########################################################################################################################  
    insertSdpTable(df, SchemaStagingTable,StagingTable, "overwrite")

    insertCols=""
    updateCols=""
    whereCols =""
    keyCols = ""

    # MATCHED Clause of MERGE
    for keyCol in KeyColumns:
        keyCols = keyCols + "source." + keyCol + " = " + "target." + keyCol + " and "

    whereClause = keyCols
    #Tidy up where clause and remove last "and"
    remove="and"
    reverse_remove=remove[::-1]
    whereClause = whereClause[::-1].replace(reverse_remove,"",1)[::-1]

    # INSERT and UPDATE part of MERGE
    for col in df.schema.fieldNames():
        insertCols = insertCols + col + ","
        if col not in KeyColumns: # Exclude identity columns in update statement
         updateCols =  updateCols + "target." + col + " = " + "source." + col + ","

    #Tidy up insertCols and remove last ","
    remove=","
    reverse_remove=remove[::-1]
    insertCols = insertCols[::-1].replace(reverse_remove,"",1)[::-1]  

    #Tidy up insertCols and remove last ","
    remove=","
    reverse_remove=remove[::-1]
    updateCols = updateCols[::-1].replace(reverse_remove,"",1)[::-1]   

    # MERGE Statement in full
    mergeSQL= "MERGE INTO " + SchemaTargetTable +"." + TargetTable + " AS target" +  " USING " + SchemaStagingTable + "." + StagingTable + " AS source" + " ON "
    mergeSQL = mergeSQL + whereClause

    # WHEN MATCHED
    if DeltaColumn != None:
        mergeSQL =  mergeSQL + " WHEN MATCHED AND " + "source." + DeltaColumn + " > " + "target." + DeltaColumn 
    else:
        mergeSQL =  mergeSQL + " WHEN MATCHED"

    mergeSQL = mergeSQL + " THEN UPDATE SET " + updateCols

    # WHEN NOT MATCHED BY TARGET
    mergeSQL = mergeSQL + " WHEN NOT MATCHED BY TARGET " # including BY TARGET clause for Synapse requires the table to be Hash Distributed
    mergeSQL = mergeSQL + " THEN INSERT " +  "("+ insertCols +")" + " VALUES " + " ( "+ insertCols +" ) "

    mergeSQL = mergeSQL +";"
    
    #Execute Merge Statement using Pyodbc
    uid = getSecret(sqlUidSecret)
    pwd = getSecret(sqlPwdSecret)
 
    try:
        cnxn = pyodbc.connect("DRIVER={ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server};SERVER=" + server + ";DATABASE=" + database + ";UID=" + uid + ";PWD=" + pwd )
        cursor = cnxn.cursor()
        cnxn.autocommit = True

        cursor.execute(mergeSQL)
    except Exception as e:
        print("Upsert to {}.{} failed with exception:".format(SchemaTargetTable,TargetTable))
        raise e

    print("Upsert statement executed successfully : {} ".format(mergeSQL))
    return
